summary: Time your arrival, grab merch without queues, and take breaks at the right moment — without missing the good stuff.

steps.heading: Why timing matters
steps.body:
- Queues steal showtime — **entry, cloakroom, bar, merch**.
- A few simple habits mean more music and fewer lines.

steps.heading: Arrival: **30–45 min before the headliner**
steps.body:
- **Clubs:** arrive earlier for cloakroom and bearings.
- **Arenas/Festivals:** check official *set times*.
- Entry peak hits ~20–30 min pre-headliner — come **slightly ahead** of it.

steps.heading: Merch: the **first 10 minutes** after start
steps.body:
- The opening hype fades fast.
- If you can skip the first song, grab merch now and head back.
- With a support act, consider **merch during support**.

steps.heading: Breaks: quieter parts, not the hits
steps.body:
- WC/bar during **slow numbers**, not during hits or the **encore**.
- Skim recent setlists and wait for the \"deep cuts\".

ctaQuestion: Want more smart concert tips? Join AJSEE updates.
title: Set times: arrival & merch (no-queue plan)
